title: Fire and Society
description: Prehistorical and historical record of human use of and attitude toward fire. Mythology and religion of fire. Traditional, cultural and ethnic variations and their influence on modern U.S. institutions involved in managing fire. 3 lectures, 1 activity. Crosslisted as ES/NRÂ 308. Fulfills GE D5 except for Comparative Ethnic Studies majors.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Area A3 and one lower division course in GE Area D
